subject: Marketing
title: The Long Game of Trust
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Long Game of Trust.

hook.text: Amazon lost money for years. Investors stayed because Bezos always explained the strategy.

buildup.text: Short-term manipulation wins quarters. Long-term trust wins decades.

discovery.text: Trust compounds like interest. Each honest interaction adds to a reservoir of goodwill.

twist.text: One deception can drain the reservoir overnight. Trust is hard to build, easy to destroy.

climax.text: High-trust companies outperform the market by 3x over fifteen years.

punchline.text: Play the long game. It's the only game.

quiz.question: How does trust behave as a business asset?
options: It compounds over time but can be destroyed quickly
It grows automatically without any effort needed
It only matters for business-to-business companies
